name: Big Stone Gulch
blurb: The settlement for MacArthur Park's newest caravan and your home
people: Constable P.J. Wright: Retired military general and capable leader of the town
Professor Plummage: A nervous professor of the occult. Though he's quite knowledgeable, he's more at home in a library than a dig site
Illuminator Jacob of the Setting Sun: Illuminator of the Lantern King. He's taken a liking to the town's grit and determination
misc: It seems the crops are growing at a supernatural rate...MacArthur truly knows how to pick a location!

name: Seamstress Cavern
blurb: A great mining colony that travels to the center of the world
misc: Rumor has it that at the bottom of the cavern is a seamestress sewing a grand tapestry and the first to lay their fingers on it is granted a wish.

name: Purity Snag
blurb: A now destroyed salt mining town, Jackie's Wacko Boys got to them before you arrived

name: Cactus Pass
blurb: A dense labyrinth of interlocking saguaro and cholla cacti
people: Emily 'Wild Hog' Chandler: An old woman living deep in the Cactus Pass
misc: Keep track of where you've been. The Cinderheart Marauder knows these paths better than you.

name: Sonora Ranch
blurb: A small livestock ranch

name: Porcupine Kids
blurb: The Living Dead walk, arrows littering their bodies do little to slow them down
misc: They seem to have a peculiar fascination with the Pale Oak Geyser, never travelling too far from it.

name: Pale Oak Geyser
blurb: Hot springs surround this geyser

name: The Long Goodbye
blurb: Richest casino in the Frontier
people: Fabian H.T. Sampson: Halfling owner of the Long Goodbye.
misc: Many enter, few leave...

name: Cinderheart Marauder
blurb: A massive beast whose paws are so hot it turns sand into glass

name: Rattlebank
blurb: A small gold panning town that has been ravaged by the Wacko Boys
people: Loose-Eye Maddie: A crazed elven leader of the Wacko Boy. She's unpredictable, crazy, and damn near explosive.
misc: The town is in ruins. People hang from tree branches, others are tortured for joy, and some luck few are simply tied up.

name: Slowspring
blurb: The biggest trade town to the East of the Frontier
places: Unwritten Wolf Tavern: The main tavern of the town, where everyone comes to drink, eat, and laugh.
Mayor's Office: Small shabby office building home to Mayor Carson and his receptionist. The door is alwas open!
people: Mayor Sven Carson: A reasonable halfling trying to keep Slowspring safe and the market flowing. He's always got odd jobs availble to ensure the success of the town.
Oilwoman Florence Bass: A shady oil saleswoman who's got a remedy for any ailment (curses not included). Though her medication is peculiar, she has quite the customer bass across the Frontier.
Illuminator Ashely of the Spring: An Illuminator of the Lantern King whose partner Rufus went crazy during travels proselytizing.
misc: No doctors to be found. Unless you're unlucky and become a patient of the dreaded Slowspring Doctor.

name: Casey Alexander's Abode
blurb: A dilapidated wizard tower that's been retrofitted with silver jewlery, weapons, cutlery, and more
people: Doctor Casey Alexander: A retired human doctor stricked with paranoid about a supposed werewolf, even though no one else in the area believes in such a thing. She wears layers of silver jewlery and continues to spread anything made of silver among the grounds of the tower.

name: Heiferwall's Mirror
blurb: Deep in a cave lies a mirror, which seems to have a will of its own.

name: Old Winds Court
blurb: Buried underdeath decades of sand, now only ghosts roam this land
misc: People have mentioned floating crowns and golden chalice. Though their sleep-deprived sight may have tainted their memory.

name: Crescent Canyon
blurb: Inside of the moon shaped canyon are a peaceful people, just trying to live day by day
places: Depth Charge: Myrtle's Tavern which she keeps stocked with all the mead one could drink. The food on the other hand leaves a lot to be desired.
The Central Bank: This old bank is the centerpiece of the canyon, containing possibly the most sophisticated safe in the Frontier.
people: Myrtle Hodges: The old elven tavern keep, Myrtle has seen it all. All she wants do is kick her feet up and smoke her pipe. Oh, and also serve her clients.
Sheriff Nina Palmer: Half-orc sheriff who was just arrived from the Old World. She's eager to keep her new town safe and isn't afraid to reach out for help.
The Grandson of the Wind: No one knows when he arrived, he's just always been here.
misc: Being lowered into the canyon at sunset is a sight every frontiersmen must see

name: Coppervale
blurb: At the base of the Chestnut Peaks, this copper mining town is pinned between the deadly Remorhaz and the mountain
places: Eloise's Iron Sun Inn: The local inn, serving fresh food, drink, and information
people: Rufus the Highborn: Ex-Illuminator Half-Orc who thought he was the chosen one. He brought terror down on these people like a hammer to a nail
Lover Thuldrus: As Representitive from the True World, he trades his wares and spreads the word of his people.
Bacho Goodwillow: Gruff retired human theif who runs the bar at Eloise's Iron Sun. He may not be the most courteous, but he'll know anything about anyone.
Ellie Goodwillow Jr: Halfling owner of the Inn, taking over after her mother retired. Make sure to check out her custom glass-blown steins, each one has a unique face!

name: Warmpass Quarry
blurb: An old quarry that has been partially flooded
people: Convert Mammon: A missionary who ended up obsessed with the fortunes inside this quarry. He lead a group of followers down. Only zombies came out.
misc: Danger! This Area is Off Limits!

name: New Almondport
blurb: One of the few port cities in the Frontier
misc: Huh, these massive walls seem new. And lots of security, lots of it

name: Domain of the Remorhaz
blurb: A large fiery centipede roams these dunes
people: The Dastardly O'Donnel Siblings: A pair of graverobbing siblings who met their end to the fangs of the Remorhaz
misc: Be silent or be burnt

name: Scorpion Catacombs
blurb: The safer path to Coppervale
people: The Scorpion King: A defeated monk who has turned to the scorpions inside these caves for companionship. Hopefully your meeting will turn him right
misc: I guess scorpions are safer than the Remorhaz. I guess

name: True World
blurb: An isolated town full of peace, love, and harmony and more love
people: The Gaucho: An ethereal elf leader, possibly the most beautiful person you've ever seen. His followers will do anything for him.
misc: Join now! Become a lover!

name: Rochdale
blurb: A run-down coal mining town
people: The Bison Who Bleeds Pearls: Deep in the coal mine, lays a chained bison whose blood hardens into blood red pearls. The town collects them and flaunts them, while hiding the source

name: Incandescent
blurb: Headquarters for the Communion of the Lantern King in the heart of the Death Basin
people: Solaris Leon van Daal: Dwarven Leader of the Communion of the Lantern King. Covered in scars that he wears with prides, he galvanizes his people with his cut-throat mentality and strong convictions.
misc: Bless the Lantern King and those he illuminates

name: Southern Candelabra
blurb: Southern Outpost for the Communion of the Lantern King

name: Chest of Hobb
blurb: Buried treasure laid by a long-forgotten fey-devil duo
misc: Many search, many fail, the cold iron still lays buried

name: Hidden Plum Grotto
blurb: A small farm of plum trees tucked away out of sight
people: Virgil Brown Henson: An old elf woman, with nails for eyes. She practices future-telling by the patterns in the sand and bakes a mean plum pie.
Bettie Henson: A hardworking halfling and wife to Virgil. She tends the plum orchard and has recently picked up defensive arts due to the recent zombie occurrences.
misc: These plum pies are foretelling, a premonition of the culinary arts

name: Chestnut Peaks
blurb: The main mountain range of the east, known mainly for its difficult terrain and its lack of ore deposits
places: Rose Monastary: Pracctitioners of the Twisting Petal Stance. Their monastary stands at the top of the peaks, the limited air makes their training even harder.
misc: Most never get to the top. Frankly, most don't get half way

name: Tesoro Tar Pits
blurb: A collection of thick toxic tar pits
places: Delian Tomb: Underneath the pits, if one can get there, is an ancient tomb. Rumor has it that the Cylinder of Spite is buried here, or was it the Winchester Book?
people: Tentacles of the Pit: The monster that lurks beneath. It has the body of a cow, tentacles of a squid, and a gapping maw unlike any beast. It loves this sewage
misc: Rumor has it there is treasure beneath the pits, or at least there used to be

name: Cactus Will
blurb: A colossal cactus leshy
people: Cactus Will: A simple giant cactus leshy that roams these grounds. Many cactus leshy in the surrounding area workship him like a god.
misc: He is the sole thing responsible for how isolated the southeast of the Frontier is. No one dares cross his territory.

name: Captain Bradford
blurb: An elvish looking fellow in peculiar dress who was riding a shooting star
people: Captain Bradford: An unusual fellow, his metal house is damaged and he needs the weirdest things to fix it

name: Barrel & Bridle Park
blurb: A daeodon racing track popular with the Wacko Boys
misc: You ain't gonna find racing better than right damn here!

name: Nautilus Wharf
blurb: A small fishing town built on top of the skeleton of a giant whale
